channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: French champagne makers brace themselves for the impact of U.S. tariffs
item.description: Even with President Trump's 90-day pause on global tariffs for most countries, many European winemakers no longer see the U.S. as a market they can count on.

item.title: Asylum seekers deported by the U.S. are stuck in Panama unable to return home
item.description: Two months ago, the U.S. deported almost 300 asylum seekers and flew them to Panama under a deal that has been widely criticized by human rights groups.

item.title: Last call for Skype
item.description: We are saying goodbye to Skype. In 2009, the app had more than 400 million users, and made up 8% of the world's international calling minutes. Now Microsoft says it has shifted focus to its Teams app.

item.title: As a judge weighs NCAA deal, thousands of college athletes remain in legal limbo
item.description: Thousands of college athletes are in limbo as the NCAA and lawyers scramble to reach a new deal after a judge put a major settlement on hold. At issue are reduced roster sizes that would have seen players cut from their teams.

item.title: Be square and get to the root of it! Celebrate Square Root Day today!
item.description: Square root days happen only a few times in a century, and the man who brought the day fame is celebrating his sixth one.

item.title: It's been 4 months of congestion tolls for drivers in Manhattan. How's the traffic?
item.description: It's been four months since New York City implemented a congestion pricing plan for part of Manhattan. The tolls have deterred tens of thousands of motorists each day from entering the area.

item.title: Israel announces a new ultimatum for Hamas and a shift in how Gaza aid is distributed
item.description: Israel has announced a new plan to take over all aid deliveries and distribution in Gaza. The plan comes as the military says it will expand its war effort against Hamas.

item.title: U.N. World Food Program to slash jobs, drastically shrink food aid
item.description: The U.N. World Food Program plans to cut its staff by a third. Donations from Europe and Britain have flagged, and cuts by the Trump administration forced the humanitarian organization to downsize.

item.title: Trump's plan for movie tariffs leads to global confusion
item.description: Production in Hollywood has been suffering. But it's unclear how a 100% tariff on movies produced outside the United States would work â€“ or who it would help.

item.title: Lifting the curtain on the conclave with author Robert Harris
item.description: As the world waits for the papal conclave to get underway, Scott Detrow speaks with Robert Harris, the author who dramatized the process in the book Conclave.
